error.signature: FATAL ERROR: Reached heap limit Allocation failed - JavaScript heap out of memory
error.regex: (FATAL ERROR: Reached heap limit|JavaScript heap out of memory)

verdict.summary: Node.js process exceeded V8 heap memory limit.

dead_ends.why_fails: Delays the crash but the leak still grows unbounded

dead_ends.action: Splitting the process into workers without fixing the memory issue
dead_ends.why_fails: Each worker will also eventually OOM

workarounds.action: Profile with --inspect and Chrome DevTools to find the memory leak
workarounds.how: node --inspect app.js then open chrome://inspect to take heap snapshots

workarounds.action: Increase heap limit as interim: NODE_OPTIONS=--max-old-space-size=8192

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'FATAL ERROR' indicates memory exhaustion, while 'Error' indicates an operation not permitted by the OS.
'FATAL ERROR' indicates memory exhaustion, while '[ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND]' indicates a missing Node.js module.
